comment: Prof Jones is by far my favorite professor at KSU. He's more than willing to help, and makes learning Spanish fun. I'd totally take him again!!!

Professor is a very nice person.  I do not think though that KSU should call this a "Beginner" level class.  I had no experience in Spanish at all and was completely overwhelmed and had to drop this class because it is taught in spanish. If you have no vocabulary in the lang. you cannot just step into this class.  Will retake after Rosetta!

This professor is awesome. He's real cool and down to earth and jokes at times. He made spanish fun..although the way he says "exelente" is sorta creepy o.O ..but besides that, he's nice and exams aren't too tough, just study and DO THE ONLINE H/W!! If you do all the h/w and nothing else you'd at least earn a C in the class.
He is a great teacher.  He is very fluent in spanish (although not a native speaker).. He makes himself available; very helpful and funny

I had him for Spanish for Criminal Justice and I loved it, it was hybrid so I only saw him once a week but it was fun, he joked around he always helped us and asked if we had questions or if we needed any help and he actually was kind of a pushover. I guess it was better since it was a limited number of people in there since we were all CJ majors

This professor is not bad at all as to what some people are saying. You can get an A in his class without interest in the subject. He does help his students and his assignments aren't unusually hard. You have to work for this class like any other, so he is not bad at all.

This professor is not as bad as everyone says he is.  He's not a native speaker, but is still good.  Class is mostly lecture and there are some dialogs.  Put in the effort for an easy B.  I'm selling my book for $50 cheaper than the bookstore.  If interested email courtxxcourt@yahoo.com

Thanks to Mr. Jones I will be spending an additional semester at KSU. I failed the class due to him, he is very arrogant, difficult to understand, and acts irritated when questions are asked. My spanish teacher this semester said there have been quite a few complaints on him.  Simply steer clear!

I don't usually take time to rate but- WORST PROF AT KSU! Thanks to him I failed the class. Spanish is hard for me anyway and this prof intensifies that. He is lazy, unorganized, does not care to help his students. He's a horrible teacher and I know at least 5 other people that also failed the class. If you want a good prof take HANCE or RABURN!
Assigns a good amount of online homework. Several speaking assignments. Make sure to attend class and participate. If you do those things he will work with you to the best of his ability.
not very interesting class. 4 test in semester and many dialogues, as long as you practice your grammar and try he will definately work with you. really good teacher. not too hard of a class.

The prof was awful.  Spanish is not my strong point and he was zero help.  He seems very unprepared, he also shows no interest whatsoever in helping students learn.  If asked a question he will brush over it at lightning speed (out of obligation) and he appears a bit arrogant.  I failed the class due to him.

Professor Jones is hard. His grading is hard to understand and follow. It is not consistent. He doesn't explain assignments well and usually does not know what the assignment is until it is time to do it. He gives a ton of online assignments and a lot are due on the same day (5-10 assignments).

mr. jones is willing to answer student questions but always seems very unprepared for class and assignments. does not know information regarding assignments until the last minute. tests are fairly simple if you study. textbook is a must and homework assignments are online.
